awd_titl_txt: Color Synthesis in a Perceptual Domain
awd_abstract_narration: This project is concerned with incorporating additional information             about the human visual system into the process of synthesizing color            for computer graphic images.  The traditional camera model employed in          realistic image synthesis will be modified so as to produce an initial          representation which is perceptual in nature.  From this higher level           representation of the scene a final image is to be created for                  whatever display device is being used.  The particular perceptual               effects to be investigated during the term of the grant are                     adaptation and color spatial acuity.  This work will make it possible           to handle scenes with high contrast and/or a large dynamic range, will          improve the efficiency with which color calculations are performed in           a distributed ray tracer, and will make it possible to reproduce color          in a more device independent manner.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
